clinical_study.brief_title: A Cross-Sectional Study to Assess Walking Performance in Subjects With Peripheral Artery and End Stage Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Cross-Sectional Non-Interventional Study to Assess Walking Performance, Quality of Life, Vascular Function, and Lower Limb Arterial Calcification in Subjects With Peripheral Artery Disease and ESKD Receiving Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: A cross-sectional, non-interventional study to assess walking performance, vascular function, and lower limb calcification in subjects with peripheral artery disease and end-stage kidney disease (PAD-ESKD) receiving hemodialysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Two six minute walk tests will be conducted separated by 5-7 days during Week 1 during the subject's participation of up to 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Walking distance in meters completed over a duration of 6 minutes

primary_outcome.time_frame: Functional activity measurements will be collected daily beginning at the completion of screening and daily for the duration of the subject's participation of up to 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Actigraphy measurements as 24 hour intervals of motion using an accelerometer device

primary_outcome.time_frame: Will be conducted once in a vascular laboratory during the screening visit or visits during the subject's participation of up to 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Compares blood pressure in upper extremities and lower extremities

primary_outcome.time_frame: Will be conducted once in a vascular laboratory during the screening visit or visits during the subject's participation of up to 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Compares blood pressure in upper extremities and lower extremities

primary_outcome.time_frame: Administered once during Day 1 of the screening visit during subject's participation of up to 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Will categorize the subject's perception of the leg symptoms associated with PAD

primary_outcome.time_frame: Administered once during Week 1 during subject's participation of up to 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Will evaluate the subjects personal perception of walking ability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Administered once during Week 1 during subject's participation of up to 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Will evaluate information about the subject's perception of social relationships, self-concepts and feelings, symptoms and limitations in physical functioning, fear and uncertainly, and positive adaptation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Administered once during Week 1 during subject's participation of up to 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Will evaluate the subject's perception of overall health status, mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain or discomfort, and anxiety or depression.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Will be conducted once in a vascular lab for subjects participating the in the sub-study during Week 3 of the subjects participation of 4 weeks.
Will be conducted once in a vascular lab for subjects participating the in sub-study during Week 3 of the subjects participation of 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Measures the ability of blood vessels to dilate

primary_outcome.time_frame: Will be conducted once in a vascular lab for subjects participating the in sub-study during Week 3 of the subjects participation of 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Measures the ability of blood vessels to dilate after administration of nitroglycerin

primary_outcome.time_frame: Will be conducted once in subjects participating the in sub-study during Week 3 of the subjects participation of up to 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: A non-contrast computed tomography scan of the lower extremities will be evaluated for arterial calcification.

clinical_study.condition: End Stage Renal Disease on Dialysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥55 years of age or ≥45 years of age with diabetes
- Receiving maintenance HD in a clinical setting for at least 2 weeks prior to screening
- Resting ABI <0.90 in either leg OR Resting TBI <0.70 in either leg
- Symptomatic as characterized by a limitation in exercise performance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Above-ankle amputation
- Chronic limb-threatening ischemia (Rutherford 4-6)
- Non-ambulatory status
- A condition other than PAD that limits ability to walk
- Open or endovascular revascularization within 3 months prior to baseline.
- Illnesses, conditions, or planned surgeries within the study period that will interfere with the interpretation of the study results
